actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means, H. Rept. 94-1296.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: A bill to make permanent the existing temporary authority for reimbursement of States for interim assistance payments under title XVI of the Social Security Act, to extend for 1 year the eligibility of supplemental security income recipients for food stamps, and to extend for 1 year the period during which payments may be made to States for child support collection services under part D of title IV of such act.

summary.as: Senate receded and concurred with amendment
summary.text: (Senate receded from its amendments) Makes permanent the existing temporary authority under the Supplemental Income program of Title II of the Social Security Act for interim assistance payments to States to individuals while the applications of such individuals for supplemental security income are pending. Extends for one year, until June 30, 1977, the eligibility of supplemental security income recipients for food stamps. Extends for one year, until June 30, 1977, the period during which payments may be made for child support collection services and paternity determination services under the Aid to Families with Dependent Children program of Title IV of the Social Security Act.

titles.title: A bill to make permanent the existing temporary authority for reimbursement of States for interim assistance payments under title XVI of the Social Security Act, to extend for 1 year the eligibility of supplemental security income recipients for food stamps, and to extend for 1 year the period during which payments may be made to States for child support collection services under part D of title IV of such act.
